meanings.definition: To provide with a quality or ability
meanings.sent1: She was endowed with a beautiful singing voice.
meanings.sent2: The superhero was endowed with incredible strength.
meanings.sent3: The wizard mistakenly endowed the cat with the ability to speak.
meanings.sent4: His parents' love and support endowed him with confidence.
meanings.sent5: The magical amulet endowed the wearer with the power of invisibility.

meanings.definition: To give a large amount of money to a person or organization for a specific purpose
meanings.sent1: The generous philanthropist decided to endow the new library at the school.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy businessman chose to endow a scholarship for underprivileged students.
meanings.sent3: The eccentric billionaire decided to endow a park with statues of dinosaurs.
meanings.sent4: The ancient king would endow temples with treasures to show his devotion.
meanings.sent5: The kind-hearted donor wanted to endow a hospital to help those in need.
